conclusion: To solve the problem, we need to analyze the given acceleration-time graph and determine the velocity of the elevator at \( t = 60 \) seconds.
The graph shows the acceleration \( a(t) \) as a function of time \( t \).
The acceleration is positive when the elevator is speeding up and negative when it is slowing down.
The area under the acceleration-time graph gives the change in velocity.

premise: The acceleration increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s² from 0 to 1 second.
conclusion: Area under the curve (a triangle) from 0 to 1 second is 1 m/s.

The acceleration is constant at 2 m/s² from 1 to 4 seconds.
conclusion: Area under the curve (a rectangle) from 1 to 4 seconds is 6 m/s.

The acceleration decreases linearly from 2 m/s² to 0 from 4 to 5 seconds.
conclusion: Area under the curve (a triangle) from 4 to 5 seconds is 1 m/s.

conclusion: Velocity remains constant at 8 m/s from 5 to 55 seconds.
